segment.source: Getting Started with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Getting Started with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Getting Started with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Getting Started with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Getting Started with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Getting Started with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 enables administrators to deploy, update, and support applications as services in real time, on an as-needed basis.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 enables administrators to deploy, update, and support applications as services in real time, on an as-needed basis.

segment.source: Individual applications are transformed from locally installed products into centrally managed services and are available wherever you need, without the need to preconfigure computers or to change operating system settings.
segment.target: Individual applications are transformed from locally installed products into centrally managed services and are available wherever you need, without the need to preconfigure computers or to change operating system settings.

segment.source: App-V consists of the following elements:
segment.target: App-V consists of the following elements:

segment.source: Element
segment.target: Element

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: App-V Management Server
segment.target: App-V Management Server

segment.source: Provides a central location for managing the App-V infrastructure, which delivers virtual applications to both the App-V Desktop Client and the Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) Client.
segment.target: Provides a central location for managing the App-V infrastructure, which delivers virtual applications to both the App-V Desktop Client and the Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) Client.

segment.source: Uses Microsoft SQL Server® for its data store, where one or more App-V Management servers can share a single SQL Server data store.
segment.target: Uses Microsoft SQL Server® for its data store, where one or more App-V Management servers can share a single SQL Server data store.

segment.source: Authenticates requests and provides security, metering, monitoring, and data gathering.
segment.target: Authenticates requests and provides security, metering, monitoring, and data gathering.

segment.source: The server uses Active Directory and supporting tools to manage users and applications.
segment.target: The server uses Active Directory and supporting tools to manage users and applications.

segment.source: Has a management site that lets you configure the App-V infrastructure from any computer.
segment.target: Has a management site that lets you configure the App-V infrastructure from any computer.

segment.source: You can add and remove applications, manipulate shortcuts, assign access permissions to users and groups, and create connection groups.
segment.target: You can add and remove applications, manipulate shortcuts, assign access permissions to users and groups, and create connection groups.

segment.source: Enables communication between the App-V Web Management Console and the SQL Server data store.
segment.target: Enables communication between the App-V Web Management Console and the SQL Server data store.

segment.source: These components can all be installed on a single server computer, or on one or more separate computers, depending on the required system architecture.
segment.target: These components can all be installed on a single server computer, or on one or more separate computers, depending on the required system architecture.

segment.source: App-V Publishing Server
segment.target: App-V Publishing Server

segment.source: Provides App-V Clients with entitled applications for the specific user
segment.target: Provides App-V Clients with entitled applications for the specific user

segment.source: Hosts the virtual application package for streaming.
segment.target: Hosts the virtual application package for streaming.

segment.source: App-V Desktop Client
segment.target: App-V Desktop Client

segment.source: Retrieves virtual applications
segment.target: Retrieves virtual applications

segment.source: Publishes the applications on the clients
segment.target: Publishes the applications on the clients

segment.source: Automatically sets up and manages virtual environments at runtime on Windows endpoints.
segment.target: Automatically sets up and manages virtual environments at runtime on Windows endpoints.

segment.source: Stores user-specific virtual application settings, such as registry and file changes, in each user's profile.
segment.target: Stores user-specific virtual application settings, such as registry and file changes, in each user's profile.

segment.source: App-V Remote Desktop Services (RDS) Client
segment.target: App-V Remote Desktop Services (RDS) Client

segment.source: Enables Remote Desktop Session Host servers to use the capabilities of the App-V Desktop Client for shared desktop sessions.
segment.target: Enables Remote Desktop Session Host servers to use the capabilities of the App-V Desktop Client for shared desktop sessions.

segment.source: App-V Sequencer
segment.target: App-V Sequencer

segment.source: Is a wizard-based tool that you use to transform traditional applications into virtual applications.
segment.target: Is a wizard-based tool that you use to transform traditional applications into virtual applications.

segment.source: Produces the application “package,” which consists of:
segment.target: Produces the application “package,” which consists of:

segment.source: a sequenced application (APPV) file
segment.target: a sequenced application (APPV) file

segment.source: a Windows Installer file (MSI) that can be deployed to clients configured for stand-alone operation
segment.target: a Windows Installer file (MSI) that can be deployed to clients configured for stand-alone operation

segment.source: Several XML files including Report.XML, PackageName_DeploymentConfig.XML, and PackageName_UserConfig.XML.
segment.target: Several XML files including Report.XML, PackageName_DeploymentConfig.XML, and PackageName_UserConfig.XML.

segment.source: The UserConfig and DeploymentConfig XML files are used to configure custom changes to the default behavior of the package.
segment.target: The UserConfig and DeploymentConfig XML files are used to configure custom changes to the default behavior of the package.

segment.source: For more information about these elements, see High Level Architecture for App-V 5.1.
segment.target: For more information about these elements, see High Level Architecture for App-V 5.1.

segment.source: If you are new to this product, we recommend that you read the documentation thoroughly.
segment.target: If you are new to this product, we recommend that you read the documentation thoroughly.

segment.source: Before you deploy it to a production environment, we also recommend that you validate your deployment plan in a test network environment.
segment.target: Before you deploy it to a production environment, we also recommend that you validate your deployment plan in a test network environment.

segment.source: You might also consider taking a class about relevant technologies.
segment.target: You might also consider taking a class about relevant technologies.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft training opportunities, see the Microsoft Training Overview at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=80347.
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft training opportunities, see the Microsoft Training Overview at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=80347.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A downloadable version of this administrator’s guide is not available.
segment.target: A downloadable version of this administrator’s guide is not available.

segment.source: However, you can learn about a special mode of the TechNet Library that allows you to select articles, group them in a collection, and print them or export them to a file at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=272491 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=272491).
segment.target: However, you can learn about a special mode of the TechNet Library that allows you to select articles, group them in a collection, and print them or export them to a file at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=272491 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=272491).

segment.source: This section of the App-V 5.1 Administrator’s Guide includes high-level information about App-V 5.1 to provide you with a basic understanding of the product before you begin the deployment planning.
segment.target: This section of the App-V 5.1 Administrator’s Guide includes high-level information about App-V 5.1 to provide you with a basic understanding of the product before you begin the deployment planning.
